long: Meaning: properly, to "wander" away, i.e. "lose" oneself; by implication to "perish" (causative, "destroy").  Usage: break, destroy(-uction),   not escape, fail, lose, (cause to, make) perish, spend, × and surely, take, be undone, × utterly, be void of, have no way to flee.  Source: a primitive root;
